Module opentdk.gui
Package com.kostikiadis.charts

Class MultiAxisLineChart<X,Y>

java.lang.Object
javafx.scene.Node
javafx.scene.Parent
javafx.scene.layout.Region
javafx.scene.chart.Chart
com.kostikiadis.charts.MultiAxisChart<X,Y>
com.kostikiadis.charts.MultiAxisLineChart<X,Y>
Type Parameters:
X - the data type of the first axis
Y - the data type of the second axis
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget
Direct Known Subclasses:
CustomLineChart
public class MultiAxisLineChart<X,Y> extends MultiAxisChart<X,Y>
Line Chart plots a line connecting the data points in a series. The data points themselves can be represented by symbols optionally. Line charts are usually used to view data trends over time or category.
Since:
JavaFX 2.0

  • Property Details

    • createSymbols

      public final javafx.beans.property.BooleanProperty createSymbolsProperty
      When true, CSS styleable symbols are created for any data items that don't have a symbol node specified.
      See Also:
      • getCreateSymbols()
      • setCreateSymbols(boolean)

    • axisSortingPolicy

      public final javafx.beans.property.ObjectProperty<MultiAxisLineChart.SortingPolicy> axisSortingPolicyProperty
      Indicates whether the data passed to MultiAxisLineChart should be sorted by natural order of one of the axes. If this is set to MultiAxisLineChart.SortingPolicy.NONE, the order in MultiAxisChart.dataProperty() will be used.
      Default value:
      SortingPolicy#X_AXIS
      Since:
      JavaFX 8u40
      See Also:
      • getAxisSortingPolicy()
      • setAxisSortingPolicy(MultiAxisLineChart.SortingPolicy)

  • Constructor Details

    • MultiAxisLineChart

      public MultiAxisLineChart(javafx.scene.chart.Axis<X> xAxis, javafx.scene.chart.Axis<Y> y1Axis, javafx.scene.chart.Axis<Y> y2Axis)
      Construct a new MultiAxisLineChart with the given axis.
      Parameters:
      xAxis - The x axis to use
      y1Axis - The y1 axis to use
      y2Axis - The y2 axis to use

    • MultiAxisLineChart

      public MultiAxisLineChart(javafx.scene.chart.Axis<X> xAxis, javafx.scene.chart.Axis<Y> y1Axis, javafx.scene.chart.Axis<Y> y2Axis, javafx.collections.ObservableList<MultiAxisChart.Series<X,Y>> data)
      Construct a new MultiAxisLineChart with the given axis and data.
      Parameters:
      xAxis - The x axis to use
      y1Axis - The y axis to use
      y2Axis - The second y axis to use
      data - The data to use, this is the actual list used so any changes to it will be reflected in the chart

  • Method Details

    • getCreateSymbols

      public final boolean getCreateSymbols()
      Indicates whether symbols for data points will be created or not.
      Returns:
      true if symbols for data points will be created and false otherwise.

    • setCreateSymbols

      public final void setCreateSymbols(boolean value)
      Sets the value of the property createSymbols.
      Property description:
      When true, CSS styleable symbols are created for any data items that don't have a symbol node specified.

    • getAxisSortingPolicy

      public final MultiAxisLineChart.SortingPolicy getAxisSortingPolicy()
      Gets the value of the property axisSortingPolicy.
      Property description:
      Indicates whether the data passed to MultiAxisLineChart should be sorted by natural order of one of the axes. If this is set to MultiAxisLineChart.SortingPolicy.NONE, the order in MultiAxisChart.dataProperty() will be used.
      Default value:
      SortingPolicy#X_AXIS
      Since:
      JavaFX 8u40

    • setAxisSortingPolicy

      SortingPolicy#X_AXIS
      Since:
      JavaFX 8u40

    • updateAxisRange

      protected void updateAxisRange()
      Description copied from class: MultiAxisChart
      This is called when the range has been invalidated and we need to update it. If the axis are auto ranging then we compile a list of all data that the given axis has to plot and call invalidateRange() on the axis passing it that data.
      Overrides:
      updateAxisRange in class MultiAxisChart<X,Y>

    • dataItemAdded

      protected void dataItemAdded(MultiAxisChart.Series<X,Y> series, int itemIndex, MultiAxisChart.Data<X,Y> item)
      Description copied from class: MultiAxisChart
      Called when a data item has been added to a series. This is where implementations of MultiAxisChart can create/add new nodes to getPlotChildren to represent this data item. They also may animate that data add with a fade in or similar if animated = true.
      Specified by:
      dataItemAdded in class MultiAxisChart<X,Y>
      Parameters:
      series - The series the data item was added to
      itemIndex - The index of the new item within the series
      item - The new data item that was added

    • dataItemRemoved

      protected void dataItemRemoved(MultiAxisChart.Data<X,Y> item, MultiAxisChart.Series<X,Y> series)
      Description copied from class: MultiAxisChart
      Called when a data item has been removed from data model but it is still visible on the chart. Its still visible so that you can handle animation for removing it in this method. After you are done animating the data item you must call removeDataItemFromDisplay() to remove the items node from being displayed on the chart.
      Specified by:
      dataItemRemoved in class MultiAxisChart<X,Y>
      Parameters:
      item - The item that has been removed from the series
      series - The series the item was removed from

    • dataItemChanged

      protected void dataItemChanged(MultiAxisChart.Data<X,Y> item)
      Description copied from class: MultiAxisChart
      Called when a data item has changed, ie its xValue, yValue or extraValue has changed.
      Specified by:
      dataItemChanged in class MultiAxisChart<X,Y>
      Parameters:
      item - The data item who was changed

    • seriesChanged

      protected void seriesChanged(javafx.collections.ListChangeListener.Change<? extends MultiAxisChart.Series<X,Y>> c)
      Description copied from class: MultiAxisChart
      Called when each atomic change is made to the list of series for this chart
      Overrides:
      seriesChanged in class MultiAxisChart<X,Y>
      Parameters:
      c - TODO

    • seriesAdded

      protected void seriesAdded(MultiAxisChart.Series<X,Y> series, int seriesIndex)
      Description copied from class: MultiAxisChart
      A series has been added to the charts data model. This is where implementations of MultiAxisChart can create/add new nodes to getPlotChildren to represent this series. Also you have to handle adding any data items that are already in the series. You may simply call dataItemAdded() for each one or provide some different animation for a whole series being added.
      Specified by:
      seriesAdded in class MultiAxisChart<X,Y>
      Parameters:
      series - The series that has been added
      seriesIndex - The index of the new series

    • seriesRemoved

      protected void seriesRemoved(MultiAxisChart.Series<X,Y> series)
      Description copied from class: MultiAxisChart
      A series has been removed from the data model but it is still visible on the chart. Its still visible so that you can handle animation for removing it in this method. After you are done animating the data item you must call removeSeriesFromDisplay() to remove the series from the display list.
      Specified by:
      seriesRemoved in class MultiAxisChart<X,Y>
      Parameters:
      series - The series that has been removed

    • layoutPlotChildren

      protected void layoutPlotChildren()
      Description copied from class: MultiAxisChart
      Called to update and layout the plot children. This should include all work to updates nodes representing the plot on top of the axis and grid lines etc. The origin is the top left of the plot area, the plot area with can be got by getting the width of the x axis and its height from the height of the y axis.
      Specified by:
      layoutPlotChildren in class MultiAxisChart<X,Y>

    • updateLegend

      protected void updateLegend()
      This is called whenever a series is added or removed and the legend needs to be updated
      Overrides:
      updateLegend in class MultiAxisChart<X,Y>
